question.long: Can sexual orientation be influenced by social and cultural factors?

description: Results from studies evaluating the effect of social and cultural factors on sexual orientation.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of social and cultural factors on sexual orientation

no.description: The literature suggests that social and cultural factors do not significantly influence sexual orientation

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that social and cultural factors probably don't influence sexual orientation, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that social and cultural factors likely influence sexual orientation, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that social and cultural factors significantly influence sexual orientation

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of social and cultural factors on sexual orientation

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of social and cultural factors on sexual orientation, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of social and cultural factors on sexual orientation, but there are mixed results on specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that social and cultural factors might have an effect on sexual orientation, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that social and cultural factors may influence sexual orientation, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that social and cultural factors may have a small effect on sexual orientation

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that social and cultural factors may influence sexual orientation, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that social and cultural factors significantly influence sexual orientation

papers.title: Sexual Orientation, Controversy, and Science
papers.quote: No causal theory of sexual orientation has yet gained widespread support. The most scientifically plausible causal hypotheses are difficult to test. However, there is considerably more evidence supporting nonsocial causes of sexual orientation than social causes
